ENTRY.refkeywords: length array x-grid x-length x get dimensionality dimensions
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Return the length of the x-dimension of a data set

DESC.PARA:
The get_dims() function returns the dimensional length of the x-grid of a 1-D data set, by data id. If a data filter has been applied to the data set in question, e.g. ignore() or notice(), the length of either the filtered or unfiltered x-grid may be returned by setting the 'filter' argument to True or False
. If set to True
, the array returned by get_dims() will be filtered, i.e. the array will be shorter in length than the unfiltered array (not padded with zeros).

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the data set to use; if not given, uses the default dataset id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")
filter - apply an established data filter to the data set before returning results? default=False

DESC.PARA: When called with no arguments, get_dims() returns the length of the x-dimension of the default data set.

If a data set ID is supplied to get_dims(), the unfiltered x-dimension length of the specified data set is returned, unless the 'filter' argument is set to True
.
DESC.VERBATIM: sherpa> notice() sherpa> get_dims(3) (46,) sherpa> notice(0,6) sherpa> get_dims(3, filter=True) (44,)
